alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Cumberland; Goochland; Henrico; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 16 at 9:46PM EDT until May 17 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Cumberland County in central Virginia... Southern Goochland County in central Virginia... West Central Henrico County in central Virginia... Powhatan County in central Virginia... The City of Richmond in central Virginia... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 946 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Richmond, Powhatan, Tuckahoe, Bon Air, University Of Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, Mechanicsville, Macon, Sabot, Manakin, Trenholm, Lakeside, East Highland Park, Goodwins Store, Jefferson, Worshams, Fine Creek Mills and Provost. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not stay in areas subject to flooding when water begins rising.

area.areaDesc: City of Richmond; Cumberland; Goochland; Henrico; Powhatan
